subtopics.title: Introduction
subtopics.content:
Integers – Learning Module (Grade 6)

Introduction

Integers are numbers that can be positive, negative, or zero. They do not include fractions or decimals. Integers help us represent quantities that have opposite directions or opposite values, such as gaining or losing money, rising above or falling below sea level, or temperature changes.

Understanding integers is important because they are widely used in daily life, mathematics, and computer science.

Examples of integers:

  • Positive integers: 1, 2, 3, 10, 100
  • Negative integers: -1, -2, -5, -50
  • Zero: 0

Note: Zero is neither positive nor negative.

subtopics.title: Representation of Integers
subtopics.content:
1. Representation of Integers

  • Integers are represented on a number line.
  • Positive integers are on the right side of zero.
  • Negative integers are on the left side of zero.
  • Zero is at the center.
  • Example: -3 -2 -1 0 1 2 3

subtopics.title: Comparing Integers
subtopics.content:
2. Comparing Integers

  • Positive numbers are always greater than negative numbers.
  • Among positive numbers: bigger number → bigger value.
  • Among negative numbers: bigger absolute value → smaller number.
  • Examples:
    • 5 > -3
    • -2 > -5
    • 0 > -4

subtopics.title: Addition of Integers
subtopics.content:
3. Addition of Integers

Rules:

  • Same signs → add absolute values, keep the sign.
  • Example: 3 + 5 = 8, (-3) + (-5) = -8
  • Different signs → subtract smaller absolute value from larger, take the sign of larger.
  • Example: 7 + (-4) = 3, (-8) + 3 = -5

subtopics.title: Subtraction of Integers
subtopics.content:
4. Subtraction of Integers

Subtraction can be rewritten as addition of the opposite.

a - b = a + (-b)

Examples:

  • 5 - 3 = 5 + (-3) = 2
  • -2 - 4 = -2 + (-4) = -6

subtopics.title: Multiplication of Integers
subtopics.content:
5. Multiplication of Integers

Rules:

  • Same signs → positive result
  • 3 × 4 = 12, (-3) × (-4) = 12
  • Different signs → negative result
  • (-3) × 4 = -12, 3 × (-4) = -12

subtopics.title: Division of Integers
subtopics.content:
6. Division of Integers

Rules:

  • Same signs → positive quotient
  • Different signs → negative quotient

Examples:

  • 12 ÷ 3 = 4, (-12) ÷ (-3) = 4
  • (-12) ÷ 3 = -4, 12 ÷ (-3) = -4

subtopics.title: Absolute Value
subtopics.content:
7. Absolute Value

The absolute value of a number is its distance from 0 on the number line.

Denoted as |a|

Examples: |3| = 3, |-5| = 5

questions.question: Which of the following is a negative integer?
questions.explanation: Negative integers are numbers less than zero. Among the options, only -8 is negative.

questions.question: What is the sum of -7 and 5?
questions.explanation: To add integers with different signs, subtract the smaller absolute value from the larger one and take the sign of the number with the larger absolute value. |-7| = 7, |5| = 5. Since 7 > 5, we subtract: 7 - 5 = 2, and take the negative sign: -2.

questions.question: Which integer is greater?
questions.explanation: Among negative integers, the one with the smallest absolute value is the greatest. |-1| = 1, |-3| = 3, |-5| = 5, |-7| = 7. Since 1 is the smallest absolute value, -1 is the greatest.

questions.question: Find: (-4) × 6 = ?
questions.explanation: When multiplying integers with different signs, the result is negative. (-4) × 6 = -24.

questions.question: Find: 15 ÷ (-3) = ?
questions.explanation: When dividing integers with different signs, the result is negative. 15 ÷ (-3) = -5.

questions.question: The absolute value of -12 is:
questions.explanation: The absolute value of a number is its distance from zero on the number line, which is always positive. |-12| = 12.

questions.question: Which of the following integers is not negative?
questions.explanation: Zero is neither positive nor negative. All other options are negative integers.

questions.question: Evaluate: 8 - (-3) = ?
questions.explanation: Subtracting a negative number is the same as adding the positive counterpart. 8 - (-3) = 8 + 3 = 11.

questions.question: Which of the following is true?
questions.explanation: Positive numbers are always greater than negative numbers, so -8 > 5 is false. Among negative numbers, the one with smaller absolute value is greater. |-3| = 3 and |-7| = 7, so -3 > -7, making -3 < -7 false. Zero is greater than any negative number, so 0 < -1 is false. |-2| = 2 and |-5| = 5, so -2 > -5 is true.

questions.question: The sum of two integers with different signs is always:
options: Zero or sign of the number with bigger absolute value
questions.answer: Zero or sign of the number with bigger absolute value
questions.explanation: When adding integers with different signs, we subtract the smaller absolute value from the larger one and take the sign of the number with the larger absolute value. For example: 7 + (-4) = 3 (positive because |7| > |-4|), and (-8) + 3 = -5 (negative because |-8| > |3|). If the absolute values are equal, the sum is zero: 5 + (-5) = 0.
